column1: Decreased factor II activity may be the result of: - Deficiency of factor II - Disorder in which the proteins that control blood clotting become over active (disseminated intravascular coagulation) - Fat malabsorption (not enough fat absorbed in the diet) - Liver disease (such as cirrhosis) - Vitamin K deficiency - Taking the blood thinning drug called warfarin (Coumadin)
